intro: Torilis pseudonodosa, commonly known as the nodding tansy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Torilis pseudonodosa is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
